Reviews.Title: “Soulless”
Reviews.Author: KnightGuest
Reviews.Content: This hotel is totally functional as somewhere to sleep. Thatâ€™s it though. The rooms are the typical Continental European â€œbusiness hotelâ€� type; i.e. small, dull, no bath and zero frills. The TV had no BBC and even the ubiquitous CNN was absent. Breakfast was a joke with very little left when I got in at 8.45am. No pastries, no ham, no breakfast tea, no white bread....all gone. I did not eat dinner here. If I had to spend anytime here alone, Iâ€™d be very unhappy. These type of hotels are utterly soulless and serve to only such the life out of you. Thankfully I was with colleagues for one night and we went into Amsterdam in the evening; on that basis, then this place is fine. The price is a little steep though for what you get, but that's the problem of somewhere this close to one of Europe's major exhibition centres. Its â‚¬20 taxi ride into the city centre. The Metro is a good 10 minute walk and Iâ€™d not want to do it alone at night. Very pleasant staff at the bar and reception.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mbond132
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Bastion Hotel Amsterdam Amstel for 5 nights, while on a business trip to the city. The hotel is located outside the city centre and the only local shop nearby was the Total garage next door! It is a little isolated, in the middle of a business park. It is reasonably close to the Amsterdam Arena and about a 10 minute walk to the nearest Metro station. A taxi ride into the city centre - to the Central Station in fact, cost 23 Euros! The hotel itself is fairly modern and well presented. Like most Dutch hotels, it has an indoor smoking room, which is hard to comprehend coming from the UK. The greeting at reception was courteuous, professional and, luckily for me, in very good English! My room was on the 2nd floor, although to us, that is actually the 1st floor! I think they counted the basement as the ground floor!? The access to the upper floors is either via stairs or a lift, which is accessed by your keycard. Access to your individual row of rooms is also by keycard. I had a deluxe single room, which consisted of 2 single beds, a small seating area, with 2 comfortable armchairs and a small table and a desk. The bathroom was clean a tidy and the shower was excellent, with good power. The only negative about the room was the state of the carpet, as something had been spilled on it and the stain not cleaned up!!?? The room was nice and quiet although I was disturbed during the night by the doors to other rooms closing, as these were on hydraulic hinges/auto close hinges, so couldn't really be closed quietly. The breakfast was pretty good and you had the option of cereals, breads, meats, cheeses, fruits, yoghurts, pastries, scrambled, fried or boiled eggs and bacon. All of which was nice and warm (where it was supposed to be warm!!) and fresh. I had one evening meal in the hotel, too, which was good. I have had better, but it was hot and tasty and you got a lot for your Euro! I had chicken tandoori and while I was waiting for it, I had some breads with garlic butter, followed by some salad and when the meal came, there was more salad and chips AND wedges! Nice. Overall, a tidy hotel that I would use again and would recommend to other visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Standard business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DutchyCan
Reviews.Content: Standard business hotel with a good location near business area of Amsterdam. Room okay in size. Room could be cleaner. Food in the restaurant is good. Breakfast is not that good though. Parkinggarage is sufficient, could be with better lights. Good 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Anna B
Reviews.Content: Great location - 20 minutes from the hotel door to Centraal Station on the metro, and ample free parking. Bed and Breakfast price good for a city centre location. Rooms are fairly basic but clean and comfortable The only downside is that there are no hairdriers in the bedrooms, and when I asked at reception, there were non available.

Reviews.Title: “A bit far”
Reviews.Author: hanado
Reviews.Content: The hotel is decently priced which was why we chose it. I sits between 2 stations on the metro however is still a far way to walk. One station is more convenient than the other. The hotel isn't flash. We found it a bit hard to get to when we got off at the station as there were no walk ways. The Overamstel station is the correct station to use. Forgot the name of the other station which we got off at.

Reviews.Title: “good for short trip”
Reviews.Author: vanhiephoang
Reviews.Content: The Bastile deluxe Amsterdam is good for visiting Amsterdam: - free Wifi internet - free parking - near to highway and train/metro ( 10 mins) Cons: - there is no hair dryer in the room. - All cups are one-way plastic cups or of paper hence there will be lots of waste. -There is no RESTAURANT in the hotel in case you do not want to go out. - door does not close properly and can be dangerous if you think it will close by itself ( there is a device closing the door but it is too weak to close the door).

Reviews.Title: “Great no-nonsense business hotel”
Reviews.Author: tk2x
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple times now, for a few days to a week at a time, with co-workers. This hotel is very good for a no-nonsense business hotel. The prices are quite reasonable, the lobby restaurant actually serves pretty good food, and I have never had one bit of problem with the hotel staff - they are accommodating and professional. The rooms are compact though not small (by european standards, at least), and you get a no-nonsense experience. I recommend you bring soap and shampoo with the toiletries as what you are given is rather paltry. The location is within a 7-8 minute walk of the metro stop, which can bring you into the center. This is definitely not a place for tourists due to location (unless you get great rates), but for business it's good. I have also stayed at the other hotel nearby, and it's definitely a step up both in terms of style and price. But we keep coming back to the Bastion for good service and convenience for our business location. The one drawback is the free Internet - it works fine for browsing, but when the hotel is busy, it just isn't good for VoIP calls... it's very unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Karen D
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel to stay in when driving to Amsterdam. Secure, FREE parking onsite, FREE WiFi throughout the hotel and located within a 10 minute, easy walk to the Metro (11.50 euro for 48 hour all inclusive ticket- Metro, Tram, Bus). Ours was a smoke-free room, however had a strong smell of cigarette smoke upon arrival. The breakfast buffet was good, but a bit high in price (13.50 euro). Front desk personnel were nice and helpful, but not overly friendly. Definitely recommend if you plan to drive to Amsterdam and spend minimal time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: kilgore75
Reviews.Content: We had to go to Amsterdam every year for conference/show. And every year all the hotels are full and price is high. Several times we end up in Bastion Amstel. It's not bad hotel, but nothing extra. Rooms are small and bathroom is just basic. Breakfast is OK, but after a weeks stay it's very boring. There is no restaurant around, except the hotel one. Only the petrol station. There is free internet (wifi) in the lobby and you can get the voucher for the room access. Also, there is a free parking bellow the hotel. We'll probably stay in Bastion again, as there are no many options for that price.

Reviews.Title: “ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: lovejumping
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was ok for the price and the breakfast was good however, the location is a pain. I used the Overamstel metro to get into town. Just outside the hotel,You have to walk under a flyover on "sand", then along a grass verge until you reach the main road with a pavement, not very cool with a case or at night, but it only takes 10 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: todger_man
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night during our recent European driving holiday. The location is quite far from Amsterdam centre. You can walk about 0.5 km to the nearest train station called Overamstel and then take a couple of trains into Amsterdam. If you walk to another station along the same network called Sparklerweg (about 0.75 km), you'll go past a community consisting of homes built out of large shipping containers. They are stacked up about 5-6 high and from the outside looked quite well kitted out inside. A novel way of providing cheap portable housing. The area around the hotel has absolutely nothing of interest either day or night. The 24/7 petrol station next door was very handy though. We tried the in-house restaurant in the evening, and must say that we were very pleasantly surprised. The food was of top quality and enjoyed by all of us.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy but no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark_39018
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on business. The hotel is located about 20 euros by cab from central Amsterdam and very quiet. Soundproofing was excellent despite the hotel being located next to the tracks but the view was not very inspiring. The rooms and bathrooms were very clean though the shower temperature was a bit quirky. Towels and bathrobes were clean and changed everyday. The buffet breakfast was good with a nice selection and the restaurant and bar are pretty decent. The rooms are big enough for two people with warm clean quilts. Staff however were distant and not too helpful. Maybe it was because they seemed to be understaffed with the receptionist checking in guests and catering to people at the bar simultaneously. The hotel seemed to be pretty secure with keycard entry into the lifts and floors. Smokers beware - the smoking lounge is on the ground floor opposite the reception and a bit inconvenient as we had to go down six floors every time we wanted a smoke. All in all a basic no frills business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great location for exploring Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: gehnash
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with some old friends. Superb location only ten mins walk to the metro then a 15min ride into central station. The staff were very helpful and friendly although a little busy as they were understaffed. The rooms were clean and functional. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless,Comfortable and Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: annegpz500
Reviews.Content: Never been to Amsterdam before so was unsure about getting to the hotel as it seemed a bit far out.No need to worry though as directions are 100% accurate. The Metro was very quick and cheap. A 72hr pass only 15.50 euros each and excellent value. Short walk to hotel in a very safe enviroment. Room spotless with bath and shower,mini bar and safe,and very comfortable.I have read bad reviews about this hotel,but let me assure you that these are absolute rubbish.Only had the buffet breakfast but this was well laid out and plentifull,with lots of choice.I am going to visit Amsterdam again and will definately use again.Just to add staff are very friendly and helpful.Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable & spotlessly clean.”
Reviews.Author: MARYLOUESSEX
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I looked at loads of hotel for our trip to Amsterdam but chose the Bastion because it was near to Amstel Coach station where we would be travelling to. We definitely made the right choice. We had a deluxe twin room, it was nicely furnished, & well presented, it was also kept spotlessly clean by the staff. The only minus point was the paper cups that are supplied with the tea/coffee making facilities in the room, not very use friendly when full of hot drink, but at least we had the facility in the first place, plus a mini fridge. The breakfast were very good, plenty of choice including bacon & eggs, fried, scrambled or boiled, everything is readily replenished when any item runs low. The nearest metro station to centraal station & the centre of town is Overamstel NOT Spaklerweg as we were told on the first day, & takes about 10 mins. If you are going to visit a few museums/galleries/canal cruise etc. purchase an I amsterdam card, this will give you free entry plus free unlimited travel on buses & the metro saving lots of money.

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: WolfyManUK
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very grubby, phone didn't work, staff were a bit unhelpful, tried to borrow an iron but they couldn't find one.

Reviews.Title: “hi”
Reviews.Author: Beca000
Reviews.Content: Bastion Hotel Amstel offers great breakfast, wireless internet connection, and clean environment. Though not really close to central areas, if you don't mind a little walk to and from the metro station everyday, it's stiil a pretty nice option. The only not-so-pleasent thing was that our air conditioner broke down a day after our arrival, and we asked the crew to have it examed and fixed the following day. They did come to our room and try sticking the key a little farther into the slot to make sure that the electricity supply was on. But later he said that he would have to "consult this with his colleague", and went away. As you may have already know, he never came back, and the air conditioner was never fixed during our stay there, even though we went to the counter everyday to complain about this matter. And other problems my friends were having such as out-of-use phones or blocked up sink were not repaired, either. Fortunately, the weather is cool so we don't really need the room air-coned. Well, maybe that's also why they don't think it's necessary to fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, upscale hostel”
Reviews.Author: tshellthom
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave us a place to leave our luggage, shower (sort of), and sleep overnight while we explored the city for 2 days, but not much more than that. The positives of this hotel are that 1) the room had adequate space to accomodate 3 adults and a baby, with a sofa bed and two twin beds that were easily pushed together; 2) it is about a 7 minute walk to the Overamstel metro station (the stop is only 10 minutes to Centraal Station); 3) parking at the hotel is free; and 4) free wireless Internet access if you have your own laptop. The negatives are 1) the broken showerhead that leaked and sprayed water all over the bathroom floor, but not so much in the tub; 2) the dirty towels from the previous guest(s) that were left on the bathroom floor (which we informed the reception desk about on our way out to sightsee and still found when we got back 7 hours later); 3) the disgusting, visibly stained bed covers and carpeting; and 4) the lack of soundproofing which made every passing train from the tracks across the street and car on the nearby highway audible. The gas station, which is literally at the hotel's front doorstep, is convenient, but adds nothing to the hotel's external aesthetic. The security measures (key card access to rooms, elevators, garage, and the front door after dark) were appropriate given the hotel's location, which is outside the main downtown area and somewhat industrial.

Reviews.Title: “Try to avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ralfvd
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 2 nights to attend a meeting in Amsterdam Zuid-Oost area. This hotel was a affordable option with parking possibilities. Parking space is indeed available, but this is about the best the hotel has to offer. Hotel rooms are small, and although clean, it doesn't look that way, not given you the comfort you need. The whole hotel 'feels' a bit dirty. It is located nearby a business park in the surroundings of Amsterdam. The metro station is a good 15 minute walk away and a walk you'd like to do alone in the evening. I didn't feel very safe and I am scared easily. Please, if you have the choice, avoid this hotel. Try for another hotel (maybe not in Amsterdam to have comparable prices).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel or dormitory?”
Reviews.Author: Hygeia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not the cheapest, but a bit less expensive compared to the hotels located in the center of the city. This hotel is quite far from the Centrum (1 km to the Metro station, then a dozen of stations to the Centraal Station, where you can reach the place you want by tram or another metro). It's located in a "zoning", so really not with the fun... Good point for people coming by car : the parking lot is free for customers. Inside, an unfriendly staff, they don't even give you a map, so you walk down the street not knowing where you are... The rooms are so gloomy: your window sight is the motorway or the railway, it's up to you... Towels were missing, furthermore they were stained, unstitched, quite scandalous for such an expensive hotel. I'm not accostumed to go to palaces, but when you pay as much, you're allowed to expect a clean room and clean items. We didn't have the (expensive) breakfast : 12 euros!!! In the room you have a kettle so you can have tea or coffee, but ours was dirty so we didn't use it. To sum up, this hotel may be suitable for business men or so, and maybe not for tourists or people on holidays. The "good vibe" was missing. I wouldn't recommend it for tourists : they'd better go to the Centrum.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for drivers”
Reviews.Author: trish_dadish
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for what we needed. It has a secure parking garage, is right off the A10 and is super easy to get to by automobile. The Metro stop (OverAmstel) is a 5 minute walk. You take a left out of the hotel and walk two blocks and there it is up the stairs. The only thing about having to take the Metro to your hotel is you have to be on the train by midnight. The cab from the RLD was 20 Euro, not too shabby. The room itself was adequate, clean, and spacious for two. The breakfast was included, and very tastey. The staff was very helpful and friendly. All in all, a good deal for the price. If you are driving to Amsterdam this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: familyfuncoordinator
Reviews.Content: There are few hotels in or near Amsterdam offering a 4 bedded room for â‚¬130 per night for a family. This had a twin and an adjacent (open door) sleeping room and was clean and comfy but no frills. The breakfast is pricey at â‚¬12 per person but compares to other hotels in town which are â‚¬20 pp. There are pleanty of cafes in town offering breakfast! Don't be put off by the walk to the train - if you are tired you can get a taxi for â‚¬20 or less. We also looked for a hotel with free parking which seemed safe which you need to do in this city. One side of the hotel rooms face the trains which can be noisy if you open the windows but didn't worry us.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel if you are good in walking”
Reviews.Author: EuropeDuck
Reviews.Content: It is a nice and clean hotel in the suburbs of Amsterdam, very good if you are traveling by car.There is a gas station nearby and free parking.If you go by public transport, the hotel is quite a long hike away from the station.(about 20 minutes) There is no restaurant or supermarket in the vicinity of the hotel except the hotels own restaurant. If you are going to Amsterdam be sure to do it on Queensday, which is the 30.April.

Reviews.Title: “Well we had a great time!!”
Reviews.Author: UkAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Myself and 5 friends (all girls in our early 20's) have just arrived back from a 4 day stay at the Bastion Amstel, i have to say i think other reviews have not been a good guideline. Apart from the 5 minute walk to the metro centre the hotel wasn't too badly located. it wasn't in the city centre, but we found this an advantage as the hotel itself was quiet. We found the hotel rooms of a high standard and the staff very friendly and their hospitality was suberb. My friends and I would recommend that if you are visiting in a group its an ideal place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Choose somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Sneuman5
Reviews.Content: Firstly I would like to say how badly located this hotel is. It costs about 28 euros on a good day to get to the city by cab from this place and akes 15 mins to get to a metro. The hotel did not have a kettle or hairdryer and we did not feel comfertable to ask the staff for anything since they were very rude and obnoxious. Breakfast was not included and cost 11 euros if you wanted it. We were meant to be in another bastion hotel but they sent us here in the middle of the night and we had to travel by public transport with all our luggasge at 11 pm. In conclusion, bad hotel stay away.

Reviews.Title: “The Breakfast Was The Best Thing By Far”
Reviews.Author: Princess_G
Reviews.Content: Hotel was perfectly based for us as we were travelling from Germany. It was slightly hard to find but good secure parking. The room was reasonable standard â€“ clean but nothing special at all and shower room was not too great. The room we had was the first one guests go past when they walk through corridors, so not a very quiet room. The rail way station is a few km away across some busy roads and itâ€™s very small but good access for Amsterdam centre which is what we went for. The upside was the food â€“ we had an evening meal and it was a good choice of 3 courses for a very reasonable amount, quick friendly service and generally tasty. Breakfast was delightful and so many lovely things to be had â€“ that was the best thing by far! The staff was quite helpful but this is not a tourist hotel, so Iâ€™d go with information already on what is nearby. Just about average hotel, but certainly would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for drivers”
Reviews.Author: MrOova
Reviews.Content: Easy access with car, for others is more complicated - 10-15 minutes walking from metro stop. "Typically Dutch" as they advertise, so nice rooms, service sometimes good, sometimes unbearable. Restaurant with limited menu and good food quality. Free Internet access, also with WiFi from hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “cheap alternative a little out of town”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We didn't want to spend a fortune for a hotel, nor stay in a cheap one - because those are just plain nasty (talking about those downtown Amsterdam...), so this one seemed to be a good alternative. It was an acceptable hotel, for our 3 day stay, we got there by car and you can park your car for free there - parking your car in the city costs you a little fortune too (I think last time we paid 30 Euros a day), so this was another reason not to stay right in town. The walk and ride with the train downtown was ok, of course it would have been nicer to be closer, but we didn't want to spend that much money. Room was clean, ate once in the hotel (was expensive but very good). So I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Close to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ThomasTPA2
Reviews.Content: The previous review for this hotel sums up the location......terrible. As the writer of the other review states, its a good 10 minute walk from the metro station. Of course, this wouldn't be so bad, if you don't have a lot of luggage - otherwise, its a bit of a tedious walk. And contrary to what the hotel says, it is not overly close to all the major tourist attractions; you will most certainly have to make a connection or two on the trains or trams in order to arrive in any part of Amsterdam's major tourist destinations. We were a bit disheartened to learn that the other Bastion Deluxe Hotels throughout Amsterdam offer free shuttle service to and from their hotel; however, this one does not. As for the hotel itself, we were relatively pleased with our room and the appearance. The room we had came with two twin beds, a large bathroom, safe and a mini-bar (which was very reasonable in prices). We highly recommend paying for the breakfast they provide (EUR 11, per person) as it is delicious and well worth it. If you're in the mood for anything else other than breakfast, you'll find the closest thing you're going to get beyond the hotel restaurant is the gas station situated only feet from the hotel - which hardly constitutes a meal. We did not find the staff to be overly friendly, as most everyone tends to be in Amsterdam. They were certainly very attentive and promptly took to our request for a taxi and internet service but they did not give the "going the extra mile" impression. All in all, we as well as the previous writer, do not recommend this hotel for the tourist. It's a great hotel for the business traveler or the person who enjoys walking and/or public transportation rides. And not to mention, going out at night may take you a bit longer to get back to the hotel since the trains and trams don't run as frequently as they do during the day. Certainly a very clean, comfortable hotel but in a poor location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Location!”
Reviews.Author: cher_ios
Reviews.Content: If you're thinking about staying here while you tour Amsterdam, I'd consider thinking again, particularly if you don't have a car! The hotel is a good 15 minute walk to the metro station, down a road that does not have a sidewalk for part of the way. Nor does the road have a proper crosswalk for pedestrians, so prepare to engage in a run of terror across the street with your suitcase. The hotel says that it's just a 'hop skip and a jump' from the main tourist area, but that's just not the case. There's nothing around the hotel but a gas station, and the hotel restaurant is quite expensive, for poor quality. From my side of the hotel I had a lovely view of the metro tracks, which were very loud and ran all night. From the other side of the hotel you can look at the 3 jails which are just down the street from the hotel. Aside from the location, the hotel is alright. The showers suck, and flood the bathroom, but I think that's a European thing, rather than specific to this hotel. I had to ask for fresh towels, they put the ones I left on the bathroom floor on the radiator to dry. Overall, a good hotel for business people in the city on business and with cars, but not for the average tourist.

HotelInfo.Name: Bastion Deluxe Amsterdam / Amstel
HotelInfo.Address: Verlengde Van Marwijk Kooystraat 30, Amsterdam 1096 BX, The Netherlands
